title.narrative: STRENGTHENED NATIONAL SYSTEMS TO DELIVER NUTRITION- SPECIFIC INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: Strengthened national systems to deliver at scale improved and quality nutrition- specific interventions, which contributes to Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children under 5, pregnant and lactating women, and adolescents have access to and utilize quality and effective nutrition services, and adopt improved nutrition practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national systems to deliver at scale improved and quality nutrition- specific interventions

description.narrative: UNICEF's support to nutrition specific interventions during 2020 mainly focuses on ensuring continuation of essential nutrition services through adapting national programmes to the context of COVID-19. Results include maintaining a high coverage of growth monitoring and promotion, reaching more than 1.2 million children under five (78 per cent of the target population) and provision of vitamin A and deworming reaching 1.5 million children (82 per cent) while protecting service providers and users from COVID-19 through implementation of appropriate hygiene measures. Provision of micronutrient powders to reduce micronutrient deficiencies continued albeit with some challenges reflected in lower coverage (44 per cent). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of caregivers of children less than 2 years old who are reached messages on breastfeeding, young child feeding or healthy diets in the context of COVID through national communication campaigns [COVIDSitRep]
Percentage of districts providing care for children with SAM as part of regular health and nutrition services
Number of Sphere standards met (in relation to the management of SAM)
Percentage of girls and boys who received two annual doses of vitamin A supplementation
Proportion of under 5 children at community level monitored for healthy growth using standardized charts every month
